00048 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00049 
00050 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00052 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00053 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00054 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00055 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00056 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00057 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00058 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00059 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00061 typedef struct {
00062 
00063     volatile unsigned long lock;
00064 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00065     const char *file;
00066     const char *function;
00067     unsigned line;
00068     int cpu;
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00070 } xnlock_t;
00071 
00072 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00073 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00074 #else
00075 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00076         0,                                      \
00077         NULL,                                   \
00078         0,                                      \
00079         -1                                      \
00080         }
00081 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00082 
00083 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00084 
00085 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00086 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00087 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00088 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00089     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00090 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00100 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00101 
00102 static inline spl_t
00103 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00104 {
00105     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00106 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00107 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00108 {
00109 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00110     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00111     unsigned long flags;
00112 
00113     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00114 
00115     adeos_load_cpuid();
00116 
00117     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00118         {
00119         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00120             /* Use an non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00121                bit_spin_lock. */
00122             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00123                 {
00124                 cpu_relax();
00125 
00126 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00127                 if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00128                     {
00129                     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00130                     printk(KERN_ERR
00131                            "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00132                            "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00133                            "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00134                            lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00135                            lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00136                     show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00137                     for (;;)
00138                         safe_halt();
00139                     }
00140 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00141                 }
00142 
00143 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00144         lock->file = file;
00145         lock->function = function;
00146         lock->line = line;
00147         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00148 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00149         }
00150     else
00151         flags |= 2;
00152 
00153     return flags;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00157 
00158 {
00159     if (!(flags & 2))
00160         {
00161         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00162 
00163         rthal_cli();
00164 
00165         adeos_load_cpuid();
00166 
00167         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00168             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00169         }
00170 
00171     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00172 }
00173 
00174 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00175 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00176 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00177 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00178 
00179 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00180 
00181 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00182 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00183 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00184 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00185 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00186 
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00191 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00192 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00193 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00194    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00195    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00196    timer interrupt instead. */
00197 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00198 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00199 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00200 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00249 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00250 
00251     /* Kernel mode side */
00252     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00253     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00254     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00255     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00256     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00257 
00258     /* User mode side */
00259     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00260     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00261 
00262     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00263     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00264     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00265 
00266 } xnarchtcb_t;
00267

00294 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00295     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00296 }
00297 
00298 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00299     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00300 }
00301 
00302 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00303     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00304 }
00305 
00306 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00307     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00308 }

00310 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00311     return adeos_processor_id();
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00315 
00316 {
00317     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00318         return vmalloc(bytes);
00319 
00320     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00324 
00325 {
00326     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00327         vfree(chunk);
00328     else
00329         kfree(chunk);
00330 }

00336 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00337 do { \
00338     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00339     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00340     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00341     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00342 } while(0)

00347 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00348 
00349 {
00350     spl_t s;
00351     splhigh(s);
00352     splexit(!!imask);
00353     return !!s;
00354 }

00414 
00415 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00416 
00417 {
00418     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00419 
00420     adeos_load_cpuid();
00421 
00422     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00423        and always inside a critical section. */
00424     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00425     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00426     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00427     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00428     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00429 }
00430 
00431 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00432     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00433 }
00434 
00435 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00436                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00437                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00438                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00439                                     )
00440 {
00441 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00442 
00443     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00444         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00445         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00446         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00447         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00448         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00449         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00450         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00451         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00452         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00453         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00454         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00455         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00456         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00457         "ret\n\t" \
00458 "1:      popl %%edi\n\t" \
00459         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00460         "popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00461       : /* no output */ \
00462       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00463         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00464         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00465         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00466         "b" (out_tcb), \
00467         "S" (in_tcb), \
00468         "a" (outproc), \
00469         "d" (inproc));
00470 
00471 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00472 
00473     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00474     
00475     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00476         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00477         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00478         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00479         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00480         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00481         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00482         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00483         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00484         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00485         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00486         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00487         "ret\n\t" \
00488 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00489       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00490         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00491         "=S" (esi_out), \
00492         "=D" (edi_out), \
00493         "+a" (outproc), \
00494         "+d" (inproc) \
00495       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00496         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00497         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00498         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00499 
00500 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00501 }
00502 
00503 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00504                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00505 {
00506     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00507     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00508 
00509     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00510         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00511            clear the ts bit. */
00512         clts();
00513     
00514     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00515 
00516     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00517         {
00518         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00519 
00520         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00521 
00522         if (!inproc->mm)
00523             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00524         }
00525 
00526     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00527 
00528     stts();
00529 }
00530 
00531 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00532                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00533     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00534 }
00535 
00536 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00537     /* Empty */
00538 }
00539 
00540 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00541                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00542                                          const char *name)
00543 {
00544     tcb->user_task = current;
00545     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00546     tcb->esp = 0;
00547     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00548     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00549     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00553 
00554     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00555     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00556     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00557     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00558     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00559     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00560 }
00561 
00562 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00563                                                int imask,
00564                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00565                                                void *cookie)
00566 {
00567     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00568     stts();
00569     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00570     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00571     entry(cookie);
00572     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00573 }
00574 
00575 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00576                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00577                                        void *cookie,
00578                                        int imask,
00579                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00580                                        char *name)
00581 {
00582     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00583 
00584     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00585     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00586     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00587     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00588     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00589     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00590     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00591     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00592     *--(*psp) = 0;
00593 }
00594 
00595 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00596 
00597 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00598 
00599 {
00600     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00601        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00602 
00603     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00604 
00605     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00606         {
00607         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00608         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00609         }
00610 }
00611 
00612 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00613 
00614 {
00615     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00616         {
00617         clts();
00618 
00619         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00620             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00621         else
00622             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00623         }
00624 }
00625 
00626 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00627 
00628 {
00629     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00630 
00631     if (task)
00632         {
00633         if (!task->used_math)
00634             {
00635             stts();
00636             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00637             }
00638 
00639         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00640            hardware. */
00641         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00642         }
00643 
00644     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00645        user-space or kernel thread. */
00646 
00647     clts();
00648 
00649     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00650         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00651     else
00652         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00653 }
00654 
00655 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00656 
00657 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00658 
00659 {}
00660 
00661 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00662 
00663 {}
00664 
00665 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00666 
00667 {}
00668 
00669 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00670 
00671 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00672 
00673 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00674 
00675     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00676 }
00677 
00678 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00679 
00680 {
00681     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00682                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00683                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00684                                      NULL,
00685                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00686 }
00687 
00688 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00689 
00690 {
00691     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00692                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00693                                      NULL,
00694                                      NULL,
00695                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00696 }
00697 
00698 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00699 
00700 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00701 {
00702     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00703 }
00704 
00705 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00706     
00707 {
00708     xnarch_cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00709     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00710     unsigned long flags;
00711     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00712 
00713     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00714 
00715     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00716        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00717        context. */
00718     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00719                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00720 
00721     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00722     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00723     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00724     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00725 
00726     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00727         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00728     
00729     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00730                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00731 }
00732 
00733 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00734 
00735 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00736 
00737     return 0;
00738 }
00739 
00740 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00741 
00742     return 0;
00743 }
00744 
00745 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00746 
00747     return 0;
00748 }
00749 
00750 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00751 
00752 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00753 
00754 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00755 
00756 {
00757 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00758     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00759        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00760     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00761 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00762 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00763     xnshadow_release_events();
00764 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00765     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00766     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00767     schedule_timeout(50);
00768     xnarch_release_ipi();
00769 }
00770 
00771 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00772 
00773 {
00774     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00775 
00776     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00777         {
00778         spl_t s;
00779         splsync(s);
00780         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00781         splexit(s);
00782         return 1;
00783         }
00784 
00785     return 0;
00786 }
00787 
00788 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00789 
00790 {
00791 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION    
00792     xnshadow_grab_events();
00793 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00794 }
00795 
00796 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00798 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00799 
00800 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00801                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00802                                            const char *name)
00803 {
00804     struct task_struct *task = current;
00805 
00806     tcb->user_task = task;
00807     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00808     tcb->esp = 0;
00809     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00810     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00811     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00812 }
00813 
00814 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00815 
00816 {
00817     unsigned irq;
00818 
00819     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00820         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00821                              handler,
00822                              NULL,
00823                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00824 }
00825 
00826 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00827 
00828 {
00829     unsigned irq;
00830 
00831     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00832         {
00833         switch (irq)
00834             {
00835 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00836             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00837             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00838             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00839             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00840 
00841                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00842                 continue;
00843 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00844 
00845             default:
00846 
00847                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00848             }
00849         }
00850 }
00851 
00852 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00853 
00854 {
00855     unsigned irq;
00856 
00857     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00858         {
00859         switch (irq)
00860             {
00861 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00862             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00863             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00864             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00865             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00866 
00867                 continue;
00868 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00869 
00870             default:
00871 
00872                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00873             }
00874         }
00875 }
00876 
00877 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00878 
00879 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00880 
00881 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00882     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00883        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00884        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00885        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00886     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00887 }
00888 
00889 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00890     rthal_release_timer();
00891 }
00892 
00893 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00894 
00895 {
00896 #if CONFIG_SMP
00897     return adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00898 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00899     return 0;
00900 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00901 }
00902 
00903 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00904                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00905                                         unsigned long long defval)
00906 {
00907 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00908     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00909     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00910     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00911 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00912     *shot = defval;
00913     *delivery = defval;
00914 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00915 }
00916 
00917 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00940 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00941 
00942 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00943 
00944 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00945 
00946 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00947 
00948 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00949 
00950 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00951 
00952 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00953 
00954 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00955 
00956 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00957 {
00958     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00959 
00960     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00961     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00962     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00963 
00964     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00965 }
00966 
00967 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00968 
00969 {
00970 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00971     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00972 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00973     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00974        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00975        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00976        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00977        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00978        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00979     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
00980 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00981 }
00982 
00983 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00984 
00985 {
00986     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00987 
00988     if (!nktimerlat)
00989         return -ENODEV;
00990 
00991     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00992 
00993     return 0;
00994 }
00995 
00996 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00997 
00998 {
00999     int err;
01000 
01001 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
01002     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
01003        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
01004     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
01005 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
01006 
01007     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
01008 
01009     if (err)
01010         return err;
01011 
01012     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
01013 
01014     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
01015         return -ENOSYS;
01016 
01017     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
01018                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
01019                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
01020                               NULL,
01021                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
01022 
01023     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
01024 
01025 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01026     err = xnshadow_mount();
01027 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01028 
01029     if (err)
01030         {
01031         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01032         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01033         }
01034 
01035     return err;
01036 }
01037 
01038 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
01039 
01040 {
01041 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
01042     xnshadow_cleanup();
01043 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
01044     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01045     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01046 }
01047 
01048 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
01049 
01050 #ifdef XENO_TRACES_MODULE
01051 
01052 #include <asm/timex.h>          /* For cpu_khz */
01053 #include <linux/kernel_stat.h>  /* For kstat_irqs */
01054 
01055 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
01056 
01057 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI
01058 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (irq_stat[(cpu)].apic_timer_irqs)
01059 
01060 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01061 
01062 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_8254_IRQ
01063 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01064 
01065 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01066 
01067 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
01068 
01069 #endif /* XENO_TRACES_MODULE */
